column5: recieved a copy of  the precision guide for  Xmas along with some line counters, great guide for lures, however I fish Eries western basin alot for wallys and sometimes troll bottom bouncers and harnesses and these are not covered in there guide, any help on this one
sure.  run over the same spot over and over letting out more and more like each time till you hit it.  write it down.  rinse, lather and repeat for different depths.
Old school, the way they did it before sonar, GPS, and trolling guides...    Mike
Trade in the old school tackle and replace with t.d.'s, red fins and spoons

i have all the trolling guides as well and i bottom bounce for walleyes all the time,with all different sizes of weights,from 1/4oz to 5oz's,i use a line counter reel and always use power pro or fireline,and with the speed of the boat and the sesitivity of those lines i let line out and when it ticks the bottom like its supposed to do look at the line counter ,the depth of water you are in then the speed and you can   right your own equasion down like i did i have it right down EXACTLY....its called making your own guide for trolling bouncers....
this is the one we use on ont trolling bible
